intro: Steiroglossa chamomillifolia, commonly known as the chamomile-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and historical use in traditional medicine.
